properties.areaDesc: Transylvania; Madison; Northern Jackson; Buncombe; Haywood; Swain
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 7 at 3:14AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
Moisture arriving from the west this morning ahead of a low
pressure system and associated cold front will spread a mixture of
snow, sleet, freezing, and rain across the North Carolina
mountains. Temperatures will generally be warm enough to support
mainly a cold rain in the valleys, but snow, sleet, and freezing
rain will be possible at the onset of the precipitation through
daybreak at the higher elevations, with snow showers possibly
persisting along the higher peaks into the afternoon behind the
departing the cold front. At elevations above about 4500 feet,
snow accumulations could reach 1 to 2 inches, along with a light
glaze of ice through mid-morning, especially across the high
elevations around the Smokies and Balsams. Slippery spots could
develop on roads in these areas this morning, and then windy
conditions will pick up through the afternoon.

Use caution if traveling today across the southern and central
mountains of western North Carolina.

NWSheadline: LIGHT SNOW AND ICE ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED ACROSS THE HIGH ELEVATIONS OF THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL NORTH CAROLINA MOUNTAINS THIS MORNING
